title: "Monarch: Legacy of Monsters" Producers Deny 3D Filming Rumors for Apple Vision Pro
originSummary: The creators of the Apple TV+ show "Monarch: Legacy of Monsters" have debunked rumors that the show was filmed in 3D for Apple Vision Pro.
Showrunners Chris Black and Matt Fraction clarified that the show was shot in 4K high def digital video, not intended for 3D viewing.
The show will be available for streaming on Apple TV+ starting November 17th.

title: Apple TV app introduces 3D movies ahead of Apple Vision Pro launch
originSummary: The Apple TV app now has a selection of 3D movies, such as Jurassic World Dominion and Pacific Rim Uprising.
The redesigned Apple TV app on the tvOS 17.2 beta includes support for 3D movies.
This suggests that the upcoming Apple Vision Pro headset will likely support 3D content.

title: Apple Developing Successor to Vision Pro with Project Alaska
originSummary: Apple is said to be developing a successor to its AR/VR headset, the Vision Pro, called Project Alaska.

Project Alaska is expected to undergo product validation testing in 2025 and may have a similar design to its predecessor, but with minor changes like a simpler strap design and potentially different configurations for the top vents.
The cameras and sensors are expected to remain the same, and the hardware is anticipated to be cheaper than the 2024 offering, with a potential release in late 2025 or early 2026.

title: Apple's Project Alaska: What to Expect from the Second-Gen Vision Pro Headset
originSummary: Apple is working on a second-generation AR/VR headset called Project Alaska with a design similar to the Vision Pro but with some changes.
The headset is expected to have two micro-OLED displays, TrueDepth camera, multiple cameras and sensors, and connectivity options like Wi-Fi and Bluetooth 5.
Product validation testing is scheduled for 2025, suggesting a potential release between late 2025 and early 2026.

title: Apple Working on Second Generation Vision Pro VR Headset - Expected in 2025/2026
originSummary: Apple is developing a second-generation Vision Pro VR headset, despite the first model not being released yet.
The new headset will have minor design changes and improvements in user-friendliness and comfort.
It will feature a modular battery pack design and an audio accessory, along with similar hardware and sensors as the original model.
The second-generation Vision Pro is currently in testing and is expected to be launched in late 2025 or early 2026 at a slightly more affordable price than the current model.

title: iPhone 15 Pro Introduces 3D 'Spatial' Video Recording for Apple Vision Pro
originSummary: The iPhone 15 Pro has introduced a new feature called Spatial Video, which allows users to record and view 3D stereoscopic video.
This feature is currently available for testers with the iOS 17.2 beta 2 update.

Spatial Video is played in a floating rounded rectangular container with blurred edges, creating a sense of depth. Journalists found it vivid and realistic but desired higher resolution and frame rate.
While this technology is currently niche and expensive, other companies may develop players for this format in the future.
There are rumors that Apple will support Spatial Video on its non-Pro iPhone 16 and is also working on a more affordable non-Pro Vision headset.

title: Apple Developing Affordable Version of Vision Pro AR/VR Headset, Launch Expected in Late 2025
originSummary: Apple is rumored to be developing a more affordable version of its AR/VR headset called the Vision Pro 2.
The Vision Pro 2 is expected to have simplified bands, lower-resolution displays, fewer sensors and cameras, and potentially cheaper materials compared to the previous model.
The device is said to retain the overall design of the original Vision Pro but with some tweaks.
It is speculated to be released in late 2025 or early 2026 and offered at a price several hundred dollars cheaper than the current model.
Apple has not officially confirmed any details about the Vision Pro 2.

title: Capture Spatial Videos on Your iPhone 15 Pro and Pro Max with iOS 17.2 Beta
originSummary: Apple has introduced spatial video capture to the iPhone 15 Pro and Pro Max in the iOS 17.2 beta release.
The feature enables users to record videos with depth information for viewing in 3D on the upcoming Apple Vision Pro.
Users can access the spatial video capture by joining the Apple Beta Software Program and installing the iOS 17.2 beta.

title: Apple Vision Pro: A Breakthrough Spatial Computer with Advanced Features
originSummary: Apple's Vision Pro is a spatial computer device with advanced cameras and sensors for enhancing visual perception and allowing hand input.
The device integrates digital content with the physical world, offering a three-dimensional user interface controlled by eyes, hands, and voice.

With an ultra-high-resolution display and a unique dual-chip design, the Vision Pro starts at $3,499 and will be released next year, but limited sales are anticipated initially due to supply constraints and its high price.
